Articles.Content:
Requires: - C7 Aviation Pack [ftp=ftp://dl.dropbox.com/u/36240098/FlightPack/C7FlightPackv2-16.zip]http://dl.dropbox.com/u/36240098/FlightPack/C7FlightPackv2-16.zip[/ftp]

- Silisko Industries Doughnut Research & Spacecraft Development [ftp=ftp://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=1109.0]http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=1109.0[/ftp]

Ever wanted to give your poor Kerbals a relaxing and enjoyable ride to Mun, landing softly on wheels? Coming back to Kerbal, without polluting Muns beautiful face with tons of rocket debris? Landing, at KSC, and being timely back for Dinner instead of waiting for rescue in the middle of the ocean after a nerve wrecking parachute descend?

Well then KASA\'s newest M.U.M.O.G (Multible Usage Munar Orbital Glider) is just what you\'ve been looking for!

It Features:

-Easy to launch three Stage Propellant Sytem

-Plenty of fuel to get you werever you want

- RCS-powered Hover Engines, and an ultra rugged gear for all Terrain Munar OPS

- Nice and friendly flight characteristics (Use of S.A.S. is still recommended though)

- And the Most important thing: It just looks cool 8)

And, if sh** hits the Fan, there is still an ejectable Command Section....

Ok, before you speed up to Mun, please take a few moments to read this short Manual

- WARNING: Ensure, that for Launch SAS AND RCS are active until Control Surfaces become effecient (around 50 M/s)

-switch RCS off asap to save RSC fuel!

- Caution: On 2nd Stage Seperation, use downward translational RCS in order to prevent Ext. Tank colliding with Strakes/Tail or Engine

- WARNING: Do NOT try to land horizontally on Mun!!! Use your Main Engine to kill all vert. and horiz. velocity (slight climb recommended). Tip over to a straight and level attitude and use Upwards translational RCS for a gentle touchdown

- For Munar Launch, just do it in opposite order. (Launch HDG 270Â°)

- No Restrictions on Reentry for Kerbal (yet....)

- Best glide Speed: ~ 65 m/s at lo alt

- Stall Speed: 35 m/s at sea lvl ( it does not do any fancy things at stall, it just begins to sink)

- WARNING: For Landing, Make sure you attain at least a 10Â° Nose up Attitide, since touching with the nose wheel first will lead to seperation of the front section, which in return leads to major Injuries and/or fatalities for your Kerbals!

Prohibited Manouvres:

- Intentional Spins ( Bob really hates spins!)

- Continuous Aileron Rolls with aft Stick aplied ( really don\'t do it..)

Additional Notes:

-She\'s kind of nose heavy, and tends to have a slight left roll tendency. So keep that in mind before disengaging SAS

-If the ship desintegrates right on the launch table, just relaunch. It seems to be a bug from KSP

-Treat her well and she will return the favour!

- HAVE PHUN!!!
